results:
Based on the search results, I found relevant information about "The Hobbit" in the context of Polish educational exams. Here's what I discovered:

## "The Hobbit" in Polish Educational Exams

### Recent Exam Appearances

In the December 2024 mock eighth-grader exam (próbny egzamin ósmoklasisty), a fragment from "The Hobbit, or There and Back Again" by J.R.R. Tolkien appeared in the Polish language test. Students had to complete tasks 1-8 based on this text.(no content)The exam included a fragment from "The Hobbit, or There and Back Again" by J.R.R. Tolkien (tasks 1-8), along with other texts like "Ciekawość" by Wojciech Chudy (tasks 11-13) and a fable by Ignacy Krasicki "Jowisz i owce" (task 14).

### Exam Structure and Requirements

The Polish language exam lasts 120 minutes. The examination sheet consists of two parts: text analysis and essay writing. Part 1 contains two texts – one literary (poem, fragment of an epic or drama) and one non-literary (scientific, popular science or journalistic), with two sets of closed and open-ended tasks.(no content)The exam includes tasks that test knowledge of mandatory readings for grades VII-VIII. Students must also refer to mandatory school readings in their essay, regardless of whether they write a story or an argumentative essay.

### "The Hobbit" as Required Reading

"The Hobbit, or There and Back Again" by John Ronald Reuel Tolkien is listed among the mandatory readings for the eighth-grader exam.(no content)The exam included a fragment from Tolkien's "The Hobbit" beginning with: "In a certain hole in the ground there lived a hobbit. [...] This hobbit was a very wealthy hobbit, and his name was Baggins. The Bagginses had lived in the area of the Hill since time immemorial and enjoyed universal respect not only because almost all of them were rich, but also because they never had adventures and never caused surprises."

### Educational Resources

Multiple educational websites offer practice tests and quizzes for "The Hobbit":
- Tests consist of 12 questions with varying difficulty levels
- Tests checking knowledge of "The Hobbit, or There and Back Again" by J.R.R. Tolkien are available on various educational platforms
- Special exam preparation materials titled "Hobbit, or There and Back Again. TRAINING WITH APOLONIA. Exam tasks. Eighth-grader exam" are available

### Fantasy Literature Context

The Hobbit is classified as a fantasy novel for children by J.R.R. Tolkien, making it an important text for studying fantasy literature in the Polish educational system. In exam tasks, the hobbit character is identified as a fantastical being, which helps students understand elements of fantasy literature.

The search results show that "The Hobbit" is actively used in Polish educational assessments, particularly in the eighth-grader exam (egzamin ósmoklasisty), both as a mandatory reading and as a text for analysis in actual exam questions.
